trophies.name: FA Cup
trophies.description: The oldest football cup competition in the world

trophies.name: League Cup
trophies.description: EFL Cup / Carabao Cup / League Cup

legends.name: Frank Lampard
legends.description: Chelsea's all-time top scorer. The ultimate box-to-box midfielder who defined an era at Stamford Bridge.

legends.name: John Terry
legends.description: Captain, leader, legend. Chelsea's greatest ever defender and the heart of the team for nearly two decades.

legends.name: Didier Drogba
legends.description: The king of finals. His Munich header in 2012 sealed Chelsea's first Champions League title.

legends.name: Eden Hazard
legends.description: Belgian wizard whose dribbling and flair lit up Stamford Bridge. Two Premier League titles, two Player of the Year awards.

legends.name: Gianfranco Zola
legends.description: The magic box. Voted Chelsea's greatest ever player by the fans. Pure genius with the ball at his feet.

legends.name: Petr Čech
legends.description: Chelsea's greatest goalkeeper. Holds the Premier League record for most clean sheets (202).

legends.name: Ron Harris
legends.description: 'Chopper' Harris — Chelsea's all-time appearance record holder. 795 games of unwavering commitment.

legends.name: Peter Osgood
legends.description: The King of Stamford Bridge. Scored in every round of the 1970 FA Cup, including the final replay.

legends.name: Kerry Dixon
legends.description: Chelsea's second all-time top scorer. 193 goals across nine seasons and a genuine Stamford Bridge hero.

legends.name: Ashley Cole
legends.description: Widely regarded as the best left-back in Premier League history. Won the Champions League, Europa League, and four FA Cups.

legends.name: Marcel Desailly
legends.description: World Cup winner who brought world-class defending and leadership to Chelsea's backline.

legends.name: N'Golo Kanté
legends.description: The engine room. Won the Premier League, Champions League, and was named UEFA Men's Player of the Year in 2021.

legends.name: Jimmy Greaves
legends.description: England's all-time top scorer started his career at Chelsea, scoring 132 goals before his 21st birthday.

legends.name: Bobby Tambling
legends.description: Held Chelsea's all-time scoring record for 47 years until Frank Lampard surpassed it in 2013.

legends.name: Dennis Wise
legends.description: Captain Wise led Chelsea through a transformative era, winning the FA Cup, League Cup, and Cup Winners' Cup.

milestones.event: Club founded at The Rising Sun pub, now The Butcher's Hook, on Fulham Road.
First league championship — Chelsea win the First Division title.
FA Cup glory — Chelsea beat Leeds United 2–1 in the famous Old Trafford replay.
First European trophy — Cup Winners' Cup won against Real Madrid in Athens.
FA Cup returns to the Bridge — Chelsea beat Middlesbrough 2–0 at Wembley.
Roman Abramovich takes over, transforming the club's fortunes forever.
First Premier League title — José Mourinho's Chelsea set a record 95 points.
Champions League glory — Drogba's header and penalty in Munich seal Chelsea's greatest night.
Europa League won in Baku — Hazard scores twice in his farewell match.
Champions League won again — Havertz scores the winner against Man City in Porto.
Club World Cup won — Chelsea beat Palmeiras in Abu Dhabi.
Clearlake Capital and Todd Boehly complete takeover of the club.
